message.content: This question requires understanding of basic physics and the behavior of objects when they come in contact with high temperatures. When something is near a running wood stove and touches it, it will discover that it sears. This means that the object will experience a burning sensation as a result of the high temperature of the stove. Option (A) is incorrect because the stove is not cool, but instead very hot. Option (B) is incorrect because the stove can be dangerous and could cause burns. Option (C) is incorrect because the stove does not make the surrounding area chilly, but instead heats it up.
